artist: Artist: David Salle; Printer: Tadashi Toda , at the Shi-un-do Print Shop, Kyoto, Japan; Publisher: Crown Point Press, San Francisco
description: woman with long red hair leaning forward on her elbows on a maroon surface, holding a scissors with orange handles in her PR hand and resting her PL hand on the side of her head; background is magenta; grey linear drawings of people superimposed over portrait of woman
image_copyright: © David Salle %2F Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York
medium: Color woodcut on Echizen Kozo Nimai-Zuki paper
provenance: Crown Point Press, San Francisco, Calif. (publisher); [Douglas Flanders & Associates,Minneapolis]; given to MIA, 2018.
signed: LRC in pencil: David Salle 1988 | LLC in pencil: Tadashi Toda
text: This layered image in which we see both a close-up of a woman holding a pair of scissors and a broader view of a bar interior is typical of the compositions of David Salle. The double-exposure effect prompts us to contend with two reactions at once—one to a confrontational image and one to an image where we have to tease out the subject and any narrative. Salle made this color woodcut in conjunction with a team of Japanese woodcut craftsmen who were brought together in 1982 by publisher Crown Point Press for the purpose of collaborating with artists from the Western tradition.
title: Portrait with Scissors and Nightclub
